author: Special Correspondent
text:
The members of the students’ wing of the DMK staging demonstration in Salem on Sunday. —PHOTO: E. LAKSHMI NARAYANAN

The students’ wing of the Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) staged a demonstration in front of the collectorate here on Sunday to protest against the anti-students attitude of the AIADMK regime.

They raised slogans condemning the Government for opening IMFL shops near the educational institutions and demanding provision of educational scholarship regularly to the students.

Secretary of the students’ wing of the party Ila Pugazhendi led the agitation.

Kovi Sezhiyan, MLA and joint secretary of the students’ wing, T. M. Selvaganapathi, former MP, R. Rajendran, secretary of the Salem central district unit of the DMK, and others spoke on the occasion.

Speaking on the occasion, Mr. Pugazhendi criticised the Jayalalithaa regime for its failure on all fronts. This is evident from the fact that about 85 lakh youth have enrolled their names with the employment exchanges. He called upon the students wing members to leave no stone unturned for bringing back DMK regime in the State in the 2016 Assembly elections.
title: DMK students’ wing stages demonstration
